byline.contributor: Elizabeth A. Harris contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo with state lawmakers agree on budget deal that is timely, but with few of policy plans he had hoped to include, like criminal justice reforms and reduction of property taxes; Cuomo abandoned many of his priorities in order to deliver budget by April 1, drawing criticism from those who say he folded too quickly; deal shows change in political dynamic from Cuomo's first term, when he demonstrated mastery of machinery of state government.
lead_paragraph: The budget deal between Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and top lawmakers included changes to ethics rules and teacher tenure, but many of his most ambitious goals were nowhere to be found.

headline.main: Cuomo Gets Timely New York Budget but Pays Price
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Gets Timely Budget but Pays Price

snippet: The budget deal between Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and top lawmakers included changes to ethics rules and teacher tenure, but many of his most ambitious goals were nowhere to be found.
